lines.text: How about this: the <c=#0000FF>Stop Wizard</c> cast <c=#0000FF>Mass Arrest Momentum</c> as he fired the bullet!
With the bullet frozen in the air, he had Slick and the <c=#FF6000>Go Wizard</c> switch places...
And then dispelled the effect! Bang! Slick dies by his own bullet!
Except- no, hold on. How'd he get them to switch places?
Uh... they sorta grabbed him and held him in place, maybe? It was two to one...
Except Slick still had a gun, didn't he? If they tried to do somethin' like that, he'd have just shot 'em.
...No, okay, I got it. The same spell explains it!
It's everything in visual range, right? So... he froze Slick, too, so he couldn't resist!
And then he moved him into the path of-
Yeah- if Slick didn't get frozen, he'd have shot again... and if he did, he couldn't be moved.
Still, I like where you're headed with this.
I'd say <c=#FF00FF>keep that in mind-</c> freezin' the bullet could be relevant.
You just need somethin' else to explain how it ultimately ended up in Slick.
